entry.title: Unit One
entry.content:
Thirty Words

Part One

  1. authority [əˈθɔːrəti]

    • The judge(法官) had no authority to order a second trial(审判).

  2. demonstrate [ˈdemənstreɪt]

    • Please demonstrate how the machine works.

  3. challenge [ˈtʃælɪndʒ]

    • This career offers a challenge.

  4. neglect [nɪˈɡlekt]

    • No country can afford to neglect education.

  5. alter [ˈɔːltər]

    • Circumstances alter cases.

    • Difficult circumstances(environment) can temper(hone磨练) one’s will(意志).

  6. abuse [əˈbjuːs]

    • I didn’t expect him to descend(decline) to personal abuse.(人身攻击)

  7. disguise [dɪsˈɡaɪz]

    • She could not disguise her amusement at his mistake.

  8. deny [dɪˈnaɪ]

    • No one can deny the fact that fire burns.

  9. manual [ˈmænjuəl]

    • Work done by machines has replaced.

  10. constant [ˈkɑːnstənt]

    • This has been a timely reminder of the need for constant care.

PoS is Parts of Speech

Words PoS Phrase matching Derivative words
authority n. 权力、权威、专家 .. in authority 持有权力
.. one leading authority 有权威的人		 .. authoritative a.有权威的;
.. authorization n.授权、批准
demonstrate v.论证、说明 .. demonstrate one’s ablility 显示某人的能力 .. demonstrative a.感情外露的、指示的
challenge n.挑战; v.向..挑战 .. face a challenge 面对挑战
.. take up challenge 接受挑战		 .. challenging 挑战性的,要求高的,艰巨的
neglect n./v.忽视,忽略 .. neglect of 疏忽
.. neglect of duty 失职
alter v.改变,变更 .. alternation n.变化,修改
.. alternate v.交替,轮流
.. alternative a.供选择的
abuse v.滥用,谩骂
n.虐待		 .. drug abuse 吸毒
.. abuse one’s office/authority 滥用职权/权威		 .. abusive a.凌辱的,辱骂的
disguise n.假装
v.伪装		 .. in disguise 伪装,隐瞒
deny v.否认,拒绝 .. deny doing sth. 否认做过某事 .. deniable a.可否认的
manual a.手工做的
n.手册,指南		 .. manual workers 手工劳动者
.. manual labour 体力劳动		 .. manually ad.用手地,手工地
constant a.持续的,永恒的
n.常数		 .. constant temperature 恒温
.. constant speed 恒速		 .. constancy n.恒定不变

Part Two

  1. contradict [ˌkɑːntrəˈdɪkt]
    • Don’t contradict your father.
  2. expand [ɪkˈspænd]
    • Metals expand when they are heated.
  3. straightforward [ˌstreɪtˈfɔːrwərd]
    • I must insist on you give me a straightforward answer.
  4. principle [ˈprɪnsəpl]
    • The system works on the principle that heat rises.
  5. enthusiasm [ɪnˈθuːziæzəm]
    • His enthusiasm breathed new life into the company.
  6. decline [dɪˈklaɪn]
    • She is on the decline and may die soon.
  7. aggressive [əˈɡresɪv]
    • He has an aggressive manner.
  8. propose [prəˈpoʊz]
    • Did he propose to you?
  9. brand [brænd]
    • These frightful experences are branded on his memory.
  10. harsh [hɑːrʃ]
    • His harsh word caused her much pain.
Words PoS Phrase matching Derivative words
contradict v.反驳；同..矛盾 .. contradiction n.反驳，否认；抵触
.. contradictory a.抵触的，矛盾的
expand v.使膨胀/扩张 .. expand one’s knowledge 拓宽知识
.. expand our horizon 拓展视野		 .. expanding a.扩大的
.. expanse n.宽广空间
straightforward a.正直的，坦率的
ad.坦率地		 .. straightforward procedure 简单的方法
.. straightforward manipulation 直接操作		 .. straightforwardness n.坦率，直接
principle n. 原理，原则;主义，信念 .. in principle 原则上，理论上；基本上
enthusiasm n.热情，热心 .. enthusiast n.热心者；热烈赞成者
.. enthusiastic a.热情的，热心的
decline v.下降，衰落，拒绝
n.倾斜，斜面		 .. on the decline 在衰退中
.. in decline 下降
.. rapid decline 飞速下降
.. phase of decline 衰退期		 .. declined a.下降的；被拒绝的
aggressive a.侵略的；敢做敢为的，积极的 .. aggressive behavior 挑衅行为 .. aggressively ad.放肆地
propose v.提议，推荐；求婚 .. propose to do/doing 打算做某事
.. propose sb. for 推荐某人为…		 .. proposal n.提议，建议，求婚
.. proposition n.提议建议
brand n.商标，牌子
v.使铭记，打烙印		 .. name brand 名牌
.. leading brand 驰名品牌
.. brand image 品牌形象
.. co-branded card 联名牌		 .. branded a.名牌的
harsh a.严厉的，刻薄的 .. harsh measures 严厉的措辞
.. a harsh climate 恶劣的气候		 .. harshness n.严肃，艰苦

Part Three

  1. commit [kəˈmɪt]
    • One cannot commit crimes with impunity(/ɪmˈpjuːnəti/不受惩罚).
  2. obscure [əbˈskjʊr]
    • Her poetry is full of obscure literary allusions.
  3. clarity [ˈklærəti]
    • The clarity of the mountain air.
  4. profound [prəˈfaʊnd]
    • The teacher had both extensive knowledge and profound scholarship.
  5. absorb [əbˈzɔːrb,əbˈsɔːrb]
    • Plants can absorb carbon dioxide and release oxygen.
  6. privilege [ˈprɪvəlɪdʒ]
    • It was a privilege to work with him.
  7. justify [ˈdʒʌstɪfaɪ]
    • The end justifies the means.
  8. substitute [ˈsʌbstɪtuːt]
    • The coach substituted Smith for Jones.
  9. evil [ˈiːvl,ˈiːvɪl]
    • His ecil designs were frustrated.
  10. stereotype [ˈsteriətaɪp]
    • He doesn’t conform to the usual stereotype of the city businessman with adark suit and rolled umbrella.
Words PoS Phrase matching Derivative words
commit v.提交;犯错/罪 .. commit crimes 犯罪
.. commit suicide 自杀		 .. committed a.尽心尽力的
obscure v.使不明显
a.暗的,模糊的		 .. obscurely ad.晦涩地，不为人知地
clarity n.清晰，明晰 .. clarify v.阐明，净化
.. clarification n.澄清，说明
profound a.深刻的，渊博的 .. a profound sleep 酣睡
.. a profound idea 思想深刻		 .. profoundly ad.深渊地，严重地
absorb v.吸收 .. absorption n.吸收
privilege n.特权，优惠
v.给予特权/优惠		 .. executive privilege 行政特权 .. privilege a.有特权的
justify v.证明..是正当的认为什么有理 .. justification n.正当理由
substitute n.代替品
v.代替		 .. substitute for 代替 .. substitution n.代替；交换
evil a.邪恶的
n.邪恶，罪恶
stereotype n.陈规，老套，铅版
v.对…形成固定看法		 .. stereotyped a.老一套的，模式化的

entry.title: 世说新语--概述
entry.content:
为什么要学习世说新语？

​ 《世说新语》这部书记载了自汉魏至东晋的逸闻轶事，是研究魏晋风流的极好史料，其中关于魏晋名士的种种活动如清谈、品题，种种性格特征如栖逸、任诞、简傲，种种人生追求，以及种种嗜好，都有生动的描写，纵观全书，可以得到魏晋时期几代士人的群像，通过这些人物形象，可以进而了解那个时代上层社会的风尚。从中可以看到道家思想对魏晋士人的思维方式和生活状况，乃至整个社会风气都产生了重要影响。

​ 《世说新语》所记虽是片言数语，但内容非常丰富，广泛地反映了这一时期士族阶层的生活方式、精神面貌及其清谈放诞的风气，是记叙轶闻隽语的笔记小说的先驱，也是后来小品文的典范，对后世笔记小说的发展有着深远的影响，而仿照此书体例而写成的作品更不计其数，在古小说中自成一体。书中不少故事，或成为后世戏曲小说的素材，或成为后世诗文常用的典故，在中国文学史上具有重要地位，鲁迅先生称它为”一部名士底(的)教科书”。
